entry.title: Tattoo Taboo by Q-Bii
entry.summary: Q-Bii’s here today to share a personal story of body autonomy, self-discovery, tattoos, and- gosh, thank you Q-Bii! It’s sweet and powerful and I hope you all enjoy it enough to go drop by and say hi on her socials ;D Instagram Twitter Portfolio Haint (Webcomic) Work has been a bit wild over here the […]

div.p: Q-Bii’s here today to share a personal story of body autonomy, self-discovery, tattoos, and- gosh, thank you Q-Bii!
It’s sweet and powerful and I hope you all enjoy it enough to go drop by and say hi on her socials ;D

Work has been a bit wild over here the past few weeks, with Erika planning out her new Patreon (It’s now been one full year with Erika side-stepped away from the site, and we’re finally putting in the work to get her, her own Patreon again! Woop!) running into some health trubs, and my first Jury Duty on the horizon, it’s been none stop!
Not too much to report other than; I’m still hiring and on the hunt for guest artists! Hit me up if that sounds like you!

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): agency, art, autobio, black, bodily autonomy, freedom, guest, guest comic, Q-bii, QBii, self-expression, tattoo, tattoos

entry.title: It’s Electric by Sayuritake
entry.summary: Oh my gosh. That first moment of intimacy. That first time you touch. That electricity! A huge thank you to Sayuritake for today’s adorable SFW and almost-wordless comic on these two university freshmen experiencing their first spark. In a lot of the emails I send out to potential comic artists when recruiting for OJST, I […]

div.p: Oh my gosh. That first moment of intimacy. That first time you touch. That electricity!
A huge thank you to Sayuritake for today’s adorable SFW and almost-wordless comic on these two university freshmen experiencing their first spark.

In a lot of the emails I send out to potential comic artists when recruiting for OJST, I always make a point of saying that our comics don’t need to be NSFW or pure science or autobio. “…heck we’d even want comics on hand holding; anything to do with relationships really!” – I’m glad somebody finally took me up on it =D I think today’s comic is an absolute delight, and I hope you do too!

As an update:
The team and I have been drumming up thoughts this past few weeks!

– This month will officially be OJST’s first full year without Erika at the wheel! We’re thinking it might be a great time to finally split the Patreon into two (one for her DBT mental health and autobio WIPS as she explores her book work) and the other for OJST as its own creature, with a team at the wheel (basically nothing changing, but now you’ve had a year to see us at work!)

– Further afield in March/April 2023; OJST will officially be turning 10 years old. We’re thinking of running a pledge drive around then for the site’s financial health and adding a bunch of bonus content into the current $3 tier (I think we’ll turn this into a fancy Pledge-drive-bonus Tier). I’m hoping to set up some interviews and pick up a few secret-bonus comics for it all. I listen to a bunch of things on the Maximum Fun network, and I like how they handle the whole ‘one month a year – they plug a drive’, so I want to channel some of that energy! Heck, we’re artist-owned, audience supported, just like them, why can’t we make that work too!!!
– We’re ALSO thinking about the winter; when our Sponsorship will be up for grabs again. Gotta work on filling that out! Do reach out if this is something that interests you!

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): Ace, asexual, Bisexual, connection, crush, electric, electricity, fantasy, fiction, guest, guest comic, non-binary, romance, Sayuritake, SFW, spark, tension, touch

entry.title: We-Vibe Vector by Hien Pham
entry.summary: Heck yes, Hien’s here to do another review! This time on the vibrating Anal toy, the Vector. “Prostate play doesn’t feel as heavenly to me as people always talk about…” Oh gosh – such samsies! It’s so easy to fall in love with the prostate-dream; there’s so much anal porn out there that makes it […]

div.p: Heck yes, Hien’s here to do another review! This time on the vibrating Anal toy, the Vector.

“Prostate play doesn’t feel as heavenly to me as people always talk about…” Oh gosh – such samsies! It’s so easy to fall in love with the prostate-dream; there’s so much anal porn out there that makes it seem AMAZING. But I guess we’re not all built the same and that reality can be a bit of a bummer. Some of these things take practice and finding the right toy and moment to ‘click’. That being said, I don’t think I’ve ever run into a We-Vibe toy I dislike; so the Vector might be a solid bet!

entry.title: OMGYES Season 3
entry.summary: Whoa, been a while hasn’t it! In the eleven months I’ve been away from OJST working on my mental health book, our amazing sponsor OMGYES only went and made a brand new season of their vulva-tastic educational series! This round’s all about toys, so you KNOW I had to take a sabbatical from my sabbatical […]

div.p: Whoa, been a while hasn’t it!

In the eleven months I’ve been away from OJST working on my mental health book, our amazing sponsor OMGYES only went and made a brand new season of their vulva-tastic educational series! This round’s all about toys, so you KNOW I had to take a sabbatical from my sabbatical to do a review here.

Surely you remember Matt’s and my first two reviews of the previous seasons? Don’t worry, you can catch up on our Season 1 review (Spoilers: we loved it) and Season 2 review (DOUBLE Spoilers: we loved it even more). I know singing the praises of your sponsor might look kinda suspect, but honestly Matt and I fucking love what OMGYES is doing and how they do it, and we sang their praises in that first review long before we had any professional connection to them. It’s just a genuinely good resource provided by folks who also help keep our site afloat and free of obnoxious ads, so… Win-Win.
While I have your attention…

My best fucking friend, my most favorite person on earth, go send him a birthday message and tell him what an amazing job he’s been doing running OJST single-handedly for almost an entire year now. I keep thinking I couldn’t be prouder of and more impressed by him and then he amazes me anew on the regular. Happy birthday today, honey. I can’t wait to finally show you the gifts I’ve been hiding around the house for months now!!!!

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): education, game, hands on, interactive, interview, interviews, masturbate, masturbation, omg yes, omgyes, omgyes.com, review, tips, touchable, tricks, video, vocabulary, vulva, vulvas, website

entry.title: Misbehavior by Pluto
entry.summary: A fun NSFW furry comic for you all this week! One that strikes TOO close to home for me; dang partners always trying to get into your business time with their sexy shenanigans ;D Talking of which – did you know Erika’s getting closer to finishing the first draft of her memoir about going through […]

div.p: A fun NSFW furry comic for you all this week!

One that strikes TOO close to home for me; dang partners always trying to get into your business time with their sexy shenanigans ;D Talking of which – did you know Erika’s getting closer to finishing the first draft of her memoir about going through the mental hospital? You can you can catch up and read up on over here!

A big ol’ thank you to Pluto this week – I know this comic was a bunch of work – considering the translation and language differences! I think it turned out pretty fun and at the very least I hope it made your week all the better =D

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): anthro, anthropomorphic, bdsm, brat, fantasy, fiction, furries, furry, gay, guest, guest comic, mlm, obedience, Pluto, porn, power exchange, prosthetic, prosthetics, spanking, trans, transmasc

entry.title: All The Love I Can Bear by Hien Pham
entry.summary: Today’s comic is such a wonderful mix of things. Autobio, travel journal, Bear culture, community, desire, and self. Hien takes us on a master class whirlwind, really shares with us his heart, thoughts, and moments, and it all hits in such a human way. The feeling of ‘other’ wanting to belong, to be loved, and […]

img.alt: All The Love I Can Bear by Hien Pham
img.title: All The Love I Can Bear by Hien Pham

div.p: Today’s comic is such a wonderful mix of things. Autobio, travel journal, Bear culture, community, desire, and self. Hien takes us on a master class whirlwind, really shares with us his heart, thoughts, and moments, and it all hits in such a human way. The feeling of ‘other’ wanting to belong, to be loved, and then surending to that place and group and seeing what might come of it.
Hien had this to share!

blockquote.p: This one is dedicated to everyone who hugged and kissed and kept me company during VicBear’s Southern Hibearnation 2022. Thank you for teaching me that it’s ok to want to be loved, and that it’s ok to ask for it. Thank you, too, to my dear friend Lauren without whom the trip wouldn’t be possible! Thank you all, again, from the vers and top and bottom of my bear heart.

div.p: AND if you’d like to get even more content in exchange for enabling us to pay and hire folks like Hien; check out our Patreon! It’s a buck-or-two-per-comic membership, where you can support the site and the artists we hire and is oh so important to keeping the site going! Truly, we couldn’t do this without everyone who is pitching in to keep this project going.

div.data-a2a-title: All The Love I Can Bear by Hien Pham

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): autobio, bear, bears, community, connection, convention, event, gay, guest, guest comic, Hibearnation, Hien Pham, HienPham, journal, travel, trip, VicBear, VicBear's Southern Hibearnation, volunteer

entry.title: Making The Grade by Nod
entry.summary: Today we have a sweet and sexy comic all to do with those little insecurities we all feel. Those unkind moments where you compare yourself to others and decide you’re somehow lacking. Welp, Nod’s here to show us all a way forward! The comic is permission to live in the moment, to enjoy yourselves together, […]

div.p: Today we have a sweet and sexy comic all to do with those little insecurities we all feel. Those unkind moments where you compare yourself to others and decide you’re somehow lacking. Welp, Nod’s here to show us all a way forward! The comic is permission to live in the moment, to enjoy yourselves together, and to quit measuring yourself to others. Remember; “good” sex is subjective – and like everything, takes practice. You all make the grade.
Go find Nod and let them know today’s comic was appreciated! I think it’s all the right kinds of sexy and helpful =D

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): acceptance, bi, Bisexual, body hair, communication, comparing, comparison, confidence, couple, couple communication, fantasy, fear, fiction, guest, guest comic, insecure, insecurity, Nod, nodding2see, novice, partner support, self love, Talking, worry

entry.title: Reminiscing with the WeVibe Tango by Jey Pawlik
entry.summary: Sometimes you need an excuse to wear (or draw yourself wearing) a nice suit, and the death of my oldest vibrator is just the occasion. This one’s been covered before but I really wanted to gush about this little vibe since it meant a lot to me when I was using it. And it stood […]

div.p: Sometimes you need an excuse to wear (or draw yourself wearing) a nice suit, and the death of my oldest vibrator is just the occasion.

This one’s been covered before but I really wanted to gush about this little vibe since it meant a lot to me when I was using it. And it stood the test of time for sure, ten years later and it won’t keep a charge anymore. If you want a long-lasting toy then this is the one y’all!

entry.title: Finding A Balance by Freaks
entry.summary: A wonderful comic by Freaks this week, as they step up and share with us their super interesting relationship while Erika and I do some traveling to see family. Opposites attract and love winning out, it’s a comic that touches on so much; allosexuality, asexuality, contrasting libidos, love Languages, and even touch – I’m so […]

div.p: A wonderful comic by Freaks this week, as they step up and share with us their super interesting relationship while Erika and I do some traveling to see family.

Opposites attract and love winning out, it’s a comic that touches on so much; allosexuality, asexuality, contrasting libidos, love Languages, and even touch – I’m so glad to have it here today! A huge thank you to Freaks for opening up and sharing with us their relationship!

entry.title: What If I Said I Liked You by Jey Pawlik
entry.summary: Jey here, with a little story about how my partner Michelle (xey/xem) and I (they/them) started going out TEN YEARS ago! Wow, time flies! We met through an online roleplaying group and found out we only lived around an hour away from each other so we hung out a lot. Sometimes you just click and […]

div.p: Jey here, with a little story about how my partner Michelle (xey/xem) and I (they/them) started going out TEN YEARS ago! Wow, time flies! We met through an online roleplaying group and found out we only lived around an hour away from each other so we hung out a lot. Sometimes you just click and want to kiss. I didn’t even know I was gay back then.

The rp we had going was a slow burn fantasy journey which mirrored our own growing relationship a little too well. I used roleplaying as JP as trying out being gay in a really safe way and I’m so thankful for these characters Michelle and I played together. We ended up rehashing them into our webcomic Dead City (which is completed now if you want to check that out)!

p.a: Find more of Jey’s OJST comics here!

div.data-a2a-title: What If I Said I Liked You by Jey Pawlik

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): agender, autobio, autobiography, dating, gay, guest, guest comic, Jey Pawlik, jeypawlik, nonbinary, queer, roleplaying

entry.title: Thanks For Finding Me Again by Hien Pham
entry.summary: How on earth do I talk about this week’s comic by Hien Pham? It captures such a feeling and vibe. That spiraling thought process of worries and anxieties. One that pulls you away from those around you and toward something dark and negative. A spell that can be broken with a kind touch and a […]

div.p: How on earth do I talk about this week’s comic by Hien Pham? It captures such a feeling and vibe. That spiraling thought process of worries and anxieties. One that pulls you away from those around you and toward something dark and negative. A spell that can be broken with a kind touch and a soft word from a friend.
It pertains to the human experience and our relationships with those around us; something that feels deeply important, and heck, I’m so thankful Hien felt like he could share it here!

blockquote.p:
From Hien:
This comic is dedicated to hugs, affectionate touch, and the friends who helped pull me out of the spiraling dark abyss by giving me love. I’m so lucky and I’m so grateful to have y’all in my life. Shoutout to my Bears Perth!

div.p: A huge thank you today too, for our Patreons who help keep this site going, and enable me to hire and showcase as many artists as I can, and keep Erika working on her DBT book. I know Erika’s still on her long sabbatical (for health and DBT-book-project reasons), but without the continued support there for these comics our site and her work just wouldn’t be possible. These past few years have been tough for all of us, but without that support, OJST just simply wouldn’t be running. And, well, I feel like I don’t say thank you enough: so, thank you, guys. Truly.

On the same note; we’ve been brainstorming a bit about maybe further down the road doing some big pledge drive or sale to help build up some funds – I listen to a lot of podcasts while I edit comics for the site, and they all seem to do a yearly ‘pledge drive’? With OJST approaching its 10th year (I KNOW RIGHT?) that might be something good to try out? Some sort of ‘Save Our Bluths‘ fundraiser? So maybe more to come on that when we get back from seeing family in June (My first time going back home in 3 years 0_o!)

div.data-a2a-title: Thanks For Finding Me Again by Hien Pham

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): affection, Anxiety, autobio, bear, beard, cuddle, friend, friendship, guest, guest comic, heartwarming, Hien Pham, HienPham, hug, intimacy, spiral

entry.title: Netflix And Anxiety by Mango-Nectar
entry.summary: How do you get your anxiety to chill? Mango-Nectar shares with us a very cute and very NSFW short comic as we watch these pair get through their first-time road bump jitters. Thank you for the lovely comic, Mango-Nectar! It’s all the right kinds of gratuitously sexy and cuddly sweet. Go visit her Twitter and […]

div.p: How do you get your anxiety to chill? Mango-Nectar shares with us a very cute and very NSFW short comic as we watch these pair get through their first-time road bump jitters.

Thank you for the lovely comic, Mango-Nectar! It’s all the right kinds of gratuitously sexy and cuddly sweet. Go visit her Twitter and let her know you liked the comic! I believe she’s also currently taking commissions too!

That’s 3 sexy-porny comics in a row! Hot-damn! Sometimes it just happens like that; lots of artists want to make sexy short comics and then by coincidence all hand in at the same time! I hope you’ve all enjoyed the horny start to Spring ;D Next week, Hien’s back with another amazing personal comic. I won’t spoil it for you, but this one will make you feel things. I can’t wait to post it!

Oh Joy Sex Toy is able to hire so many talented artists covering a wide variety of topics each week because of the patrons on Patreon! Join us there to get more pictures, writing, and comics in exchange for your patronage. Truly it means the world and we can’t make this site possible without the kindness you all show over there.

June’s coming up and so is a trip I have to make to go see family in England! While I’m away I’ll still be available to hit up for guest comic slots (we’re always looking for comic artists to work with!) but might be a little slower to respond. That’ll be my first trip out of the states in a whillllle, which me luck! =D

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): Anxiety, condom, fantasy, fiction, first time, firsttime, guest, guest comic, jitters, Mango Nectar, MangoNectar, performance anxiety, virgin, virginal

entry.title: We Need A Professional by Alimony
entry.summary: Take a DEEP dive into Alimony‘s hot and very NSFW comic! Listen, we’ve all been there. It’s late, you and your boo can’t figure out how to make butt-play ‘happen’, so after some frustrated first attempts you go ahead and whip out the demonic-portal book and summon a Succubus. You know, usual Tuesday stuff. ;D […]

div.p: Take a DEEP dive into Alimony‘s hot and very NSFW comic!

Listen, we’ve all been there. It’s late, you and your boo can’t figure out how to make butt-play ‘happen’, so after some frustrated first attempts you go ahead and whip out the demonic-portal book and summon a Succubus. You know, usual Tuesday stuff. ;D

Alimony’s art and characters are just so dang pretty. A huge thank you so making this bit of fun for us, Alimony!
Psst; She just opened up for commissions by the way! Get’em while they’re hot!

Next week we’ve got another saucy comic to look forward to; somehow I managed to get 3 in a row?! Springtime really bring out the horny comics!
Hoping you are all doing well out there friends!

Reach out to Ray, let them know they’re fantastic, or better yet; sign onto their Patreon!

entry.title: Shirtless At Last by Jey Pawlik
entry.summary: Hey y’all, summer is on its way and I wanted to share a real good moment I had last summer when I went swimming for the first time since I had top surgery. I was eight months post-op at the time. It was a moment I was looking forward to for years and I’m so […]

div.p: Hey y’all, summer is on its way and I wanted to share a real good moment I had last summer when I went swimming for the first time since I had top surgery. I was eight months post-op at the time. It was a moment I was looking forward to for years and I’m so happy that I get to experience this every summer from now on!

p.em: A note: if you’re getting or have gotten top surgery make sure you wear sun screen with a SPF of 30 to 50 for the first year or two. Sun exposure can darken scars permanently, making them more noticeable. For the sake of this comic I did not include sunscreen but I was very diligent on wearing it.

p.a: Find more of Jey’s OJST comics here!

div.data-a2a-title: Shirtless At Last by Jey Pawlik

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): autobio, gender, guest, guest comic, Jey Pawlik, jeypawlik, nonbinary, surgery, swim, swimming, Top Surgery, trans, transgender, transition, transmasc

entry.title: bVibe Triplet Anal Beads by Hien Pham
entry.summary: Anal Bead Sex Toy Review – Woooo! Gosh, it sure has been a while since we got a review up and done huh? Turns out, getting things to Australia is a toughie. A huge thank you to Hien Pham for stepping up to the plate and taking on the bVibe Triplet! (And a mighty second […]

div.p:
Anal Bead Sex Toy Review – Woooo!
Gosh, it sure has been a while since we got a review up and done huh? Turns out, getting things to Australia is a toughie. A huge thank you to Hien Pham for stepping up to the plate and taking on the bVibe Triplet! (And a mighty second thank you to the bVibe team!) Reviews are a whole other kind of comic, and opening up and talking honestly about your own masturbatory practices is really tough, both on a personal and artistic-comic level.

I’ve had tons of requests over the years to cover vibrating anal beads – and hadn’t really ever found a set that felt good to me. Really excited to have one for the site that we can finally get behind!

entry.title: Oneself by Nadhir Nor
entry.summary: ‘Loneliness is still time spent with the world’ – A quote by Ocean Vuong that Nadhir asked me to share with today’s comic. A huge thanks to Nadhir Nor for giving us such a great little comic today. His art is just stunning and we’re lucky to have some of it on the site. Drop […]

div.p: ‘Loneliness is still time spent with the world’ – A quote by Ocean Vuong that Nadhir asked me to share with today’s comic.
A huge thanks to Nadhir Nor for giving us such a great little comic today. His art is just stunning and we’re lucky to have some of it on the site. Drop him a follow or two with the links below!

entry.title: Ch-Ch-Changes by Rush
entry.summary: Today’s comic is all about transformation fetishes! A huge thank you to Rush for making us this fun gem of a comic. Covering a fetish is always tough to do! So getting a comical and joyous informative take like this means the world. Thank you again Rush! Go transform and then hunt Rush down yourself. […]

div.p: Today’s comic is all about transformation fetishes! A huge thank you to Rush for making us this fun gem of a comic. Covering a fetish is always tough to do! So getting a comical and joyous informative take like this means the world. Thank you again Rush!
Go transform and then hunt Rush down yourself. They’re pretty swell and deserve all the likes and follows you can spare!

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): anthromorphic, female, fetish, furry, imagination, kink, male, Rush, transform, Transformation, werewolf

entry.title: What’s In A Name? by Jey Pawlik
entry.summary: Coming at you this month with the story of how I found my name! This is one of the questions I get a lot; how I picked a name for myself, so here’s how I did it. I hope this helps anyone who’s on the hunt for their perfect name, whatever method you pick or […]

img.alt: What’s In A Name? by Jey Pawlik
img.title: What’s In A Name? by Jey Pawlik

div.p: Coming at you this month with the story of how I found my name! This is one of the questions I get a lot; how I picked a name for myself, so here’s how I did it. I hope this helps anyone who’s on the hunt for their perfect name, whatever method you pick or the name you chose will be the right one for you!

p.a: Find more of Jey’s OJST comics here!

div.data-a2a-title: What’s In A Name? by Jey Pawlik

entry.title: A Comforting Weight by Hien Pham
entry.summary: Reading Hien‘s lovely comic sent me right back to my early days exploring Portland and building my own community. Love it so dang much. Thank you as ever, Hien. He remains a master of crafting these insightful, intimate autobio stories. See the rest of the Hien Pham OJST collection here! Message From Hien Pham! Many […]

div.p: Reading Hien‘s lovely comic sent me right back to my early days exploring Portland and building my own community. Love it so dang much. Thank you as ever, Hien. He remains a master of crafting these insightful, intimate autobio stories.
See the rest of the Hien Pham OJST collection here!
div.blockquote:
Message From Hien Pham!
Many thanks to my dear friend Kallan Beau Watkins of Moose Knuckle Leather for showing me the documentary Bear Run! Thank you for your hugs, kisses, stories, and work hangs where you play me heavy metal while I draw dicks and twirl around in your fitting room!

div.data-a2a-title: A Comforting Weight by Hien Pham

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): autobio, bear, beard, confidence, documentary, fashion, femme, friendship, gay, gay male, ginger, guest, guest comic, harness, Hien Pham, HienPham, Kallan Beau Watkins, Kallan Watkins, leather, Moose Knuckle Leather, mooseknuckleleather, skirt

entry.title: Erika Update!
entry.summary: Hey! Erika here! You still remember me, right? …I drew all the pink comics on this site for the first, like, 8.5 years of its existence? Yeah, that was me! Well it’s been a while and I thought it was about time I gave you all an update on where I’ve been and why! After […]

div.div:
Hey! Erika here! You still remember me, right? …I drew all the pink comics on this site for the first, like, 8.5 years of its existence? Yeah, that was me!
Well it’s been a while and I thought it was about time I gave you all an update on where I’ve been and why!
After nearly a decade of working on OJST non-stop, I was feeling preeeeetty burnt out so I’ve been taking the last seven months to switch gears for my creativity and health. What does one do when they take a break from their long-running, deeply personal and frequently autobiographical comic series? One starts a new deeply personal, entirely autobiographical graphic novel, of course!
over on my Patreon. I’m already past 70 rough pages! If you saw some of my earlier OJST comics that mentioned going through IOP and wondered “What the heck even is that?”, then
Letters From Space Camp is for you!
Aside from comics, I’ve also been making lots of cool shit too, with the Good Posts about them going up (mostly publicly! For free!) on my Patreon. Oh, and I just made an Instagram account to show off my extremely cool and not at all unnerving Lady Lovely Locks collection, despite intense discouragement from multiple people who love and care about me. Could an unstable person make….THIS?
I rest my case.
Anyway, I just wanted to let you guys know I’m still alive and I am just so incredibly grateful for and impressed by all the hard work that Matt and the newly assembled OJST Team have put into keeping this site running without my participation so that I have the time and energy to rest and work on my other projects for a bit. It’s been fascinating and heart-filling to see this place fill up with comics by other creators. Obviously, we’ve always showcased the work of additional cartoonists, but to see this site become more of a community-driven resource that shares an even wider variety of views and experiences, I dunno man, it just feels good. AND it’s making me inspired for my own OJST comics again??? I don’t wanna get anyone’s hopes up or anything, but there may be a comic or two from Matt and me again in the future.
This time away from the regular grind has been good for my brain and heart. It’s helping me see what I loved about this place and career in the first place. I feel so lucky to have produced all the OJST comics that I did and I’m proud of what this site has become and I’m so, so, so grateful I have the support to take some time to myself to recover. Thank you everyone for sticking around and all your support over the years.
└ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): intensive outpatient program, IOP, lady lovely locks, letters from space camp, memoir, mental health, personal

entry.title: Why Not Both? by Menthaam
entry.summary: How beautiful is this comic by Menthaam? Every illustration is just so inviting and friendly while covering a subject that can be so fraught and confusing for so many. Menthaam isn’t alone in questioning their sexual orientation and bouncing back and forth between labels. For a good number of folks, their sexual orientation is fixed […]

div.p: How beautiful is this comic by Menthaam? Every illustration is just so inviting and friendly while covering a subject that can be so fraught and confusing for so many. Menthaam isn’t alone in questioning their sexual orientation and bouncing back and forth between labels. For a good number of folks, their sexual orientation is fixed and consistent, but for the rest of us… well, over the course of your life, you may be surprised to find out who you are attracted to, and that’s ok! Sexuality can be a flexible and surprising thing.

Added NOTE (3/22/22) Menthaam’s lovely comic today is all about her own personal experiences and definitions of sexuality growing up while living in Russia. We very much want a wide variety of people’s personal stories here on OJST, from different countries and cultures and translated from other languages, like this one.
Bisexuality can be far more than a binary and we strongly encourage you to research and learn more to find what works best for you. Check out some of our comics on sexuality and bisexuality!

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): anthro, anthropomorphic, Attraction, autobio, Bisexual, furries, furry, guest, guest comic, lgbt, menthaam, queer, sexuality

Hey! Erika here! You still remember me, right? …I drew all the pink comics on this site for the first, like, 8.5 years of its existence? Yeah, that was me!
Well it’s been a while and I thought it was about time I gave you all an update on where I’ve been and why!
After nearly a decade of working on OJST non-stop, I was feeling preeeeetty burnt out so I’ve been taking the last seven months to switch gears for my creativity and health. What does one do when they take a break from their long-running, deeply personal and frequently autobiographical comic series? One starts a new deeply personal, entirely autobiographical graphic novel, of course!
over on my Patreon. I’m already past 70 rough pages! If you saw some of my earlier OJST comics that mentioned going through IOP and wondered “What the heck even is that?”, then
Letters From Space Camp is for you!
Aside from comics, I’ve also been making lots of cool shit too, with the Good Posts about them going up (mostly publicly! For free!) on my Patreon. Oh, and I just made an Instagram account to show off my extremely cool and not at all unnerving Lady Lovely Locks collection, despite intense discouragement from multiple people who love and care about me. Could an unstable person make….THIS?
I rest my case.
Anyway, I just wanted to let you guys know I’m still alive and I am just so incredibly grateful for and impressed by all the hard work that Matt and the newly assembled OJST Team have put into keeping this site running without my participation so that I have the time and energy to rest and work on my other projects for a bit. It’s been fascinating and heart-filling to see this place fill up with comics by other creators. Obviously, we’ve always showcased the work of additional cartoonists, but to see this site become more of a community-driven resource that shares an even wider variety of views and experiences, I dunno man, it just feels good. AND it’s making me inspired for my own OJST comics again??? I don’t wanna get anyone’s hopes up or anything, but there may be a comic or two from Matt and me again in the future.
This time away from the regular grind has been good for my brain and heart. It’s helping me see what I loved about this place and career in the first place. I feel so lucky to have produced all the OJST comics that I did and I’m proud of what this site has become and I’m so, so, so grateful I have the support to take some time to myself to recover. Thank you everyone for sticking around and all your support over the years.
└ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): intensive outpatient program, IOP, lady lovely locks, letters from space camp, memoir, mental health, personal

entry.title: A Deal With The Devil by Luny
entry.summary: Short, silly, and super duper sexy. I adore it and hope you do too =D Last year, while on the hunt for artists to hit up for comics, I stumbled across this gem of a short comic* by Luny (in fact, if you enjoyed today’s comic I highly recommend you peek at the tweet for […]

img.alt: A Deal With The Devil by Luny
img.title: A Deal With The Devil by Luny

div.p: Short, silly, and super duper sexy. I adore it and hope you do too =D

Last year, while on the hunt for artists to hit up for comics, I stumbled across this gem of a short comic* by Luny (in fact, if you enjoyed today’s comic I highly recommend you peek at the tweet for some bonus art ;D ). I instantly fell in love with the idea and had to reach out and ask if he’d be game to make us a whole comic around it. Luckily he said yes!
Hit up Luny on his socials and Patreon! Tell him he’s fantastic =D
*A short comic that was built from a tumblr post that Luny made sure to get permission to draw up for today’s comic =).

div.data-a2a-title: A Deal With The Devil by Luny

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): deal, Devil, Fae, fantasy, fiction, guest, guest comic, Lun, Luny, pregnancy

entry.title: Ghost Scent by Rithion
entry.summary: We’ve got a saucy, sexy one for you this week! By the talented Rithion! I think it’s really fun to see what Rithion did here, trying to showing something as abstract as a ghostly scent in a visual comic form. =D Rithion worked on this, gosh, I don’t know 4? 5? months ago, right in […]

div.p: We’ve got a saucy, sexy one for you this week! By the talented Rithion! I think it’s really fun to see what Rithion did here, trying to showing something as abstract as a ghostly scent in a visual comic form. =D

Rithion worked on this, gosh, I don’t know 4? 5? months ago, right in the middle of all that scrambling we had to do while we rethought OJST and built the team! So I’m really happy to finally share the end comic with you all. Hope you all like it!

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): fantasizing, fantasy, fiction, guest, guest comic, long distance, long distance relationship, masturbation, memory, olfactory, Rithion, Scent, Smell, trans, transgender

entry.title: Growing Up Without Sex-Ed by Jey Pawlik
entry.summary: Hey everyone, thanks so much for reading this very personal story of mine. It’s something I’ve dealt with for a long time, realizing that what my late mother did was wrong and really affected how I grew up. I’ve come out of it all as a better person and now I draw porn for work! […]

img.alt: Growing Up Without Sex-Ed by Jey Pawlik
img.title: Growing Up Without Sex-Ed by Jey Pawlik

div.p: Hey everyone, thanks so much for reading this very personal story of mine. It’s something I’ve dealt with for a long time, realizing that what my late mother did was wrong and really affected how I grew up. I’ve come out of it all as a better person and now I draw porn for work!

Matthew here with a bonus link:
– Jey has their own Catagory now! So click on over for more amazing Jey comics!

div.data-a2a-title: Growing Up Without Sex-Ed by Jey Pawlik

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): autobio, bullet vibe, development, growth, guest, guest comic, Jey Pawlik, jeypawlik, misinformation, sex ed

entry.title: Refuge by Hien Pham
entry.summary: It’s ok to hurt. It’s ok to need time. Try to be kind to yourself. Hien Pham is our artist today, showing us all today how powerful and important comics are. I can’t thank him enough for sharing such a moving personal story with us and I truly feel honored to have it on the […]

div.p:
It’s ok to hurt. It’s ok to need time.
Try to be kind to yourself.

Hien Pham is our artist today, showing us all today how powerful and important comics are. I can’t thank him enough for sharing such a moving personal story with us and I truly feel honored to have it on the site. If you want to see the rest of his OJST comics, check them out here. Then go drop him a follow or two on his socials. I promise you won’t regret it.

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): autobio, break up, Breakup, breathe, canine, Crying, dog, guest, guest comic, healing, Heartbreak, Hien Pham, HienPham, process, processing, Refuge, rescue, rest, shelter, Tears, trauma, walk

entry.title: Seeing My Body As Nonbinary by Christine Suggs
entry.summary: Christine Suggs tells us the story of who they are and what their body has meant to them over the years! A lovely beat-by-beat play of growth and exploration and most importantly (I think) kindness for oneself. That final panel just hits so hard! I hope you all love it as much as we do […]

img.alt: Seeing My Body As Nonbinary by Christine Suggs
img.title: Seeing My Body As Nonbinary by Christine Suggs

div.p: Christine Suggs tells us the story of who they are and what their body has meant to them over the years! A lovely beat-by-beat play of growth and exploration and most importantly (I think) kindness for oneself. That final panel just hits so hard!
I hope you all love it as much as we do and go tell Christine how fantastic they are!
Hoping you all had a lovely Valentine’s! Erika and I sat in and ate reheated Ikea meatballs… the perfect night ;D

div.data-a2a-title: Seeing My Body As Nonbinary by Christine Suggs

div.div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): autobio, Bisexual, body image, body positive, Christine Suggs, fat, fat positive, gender, gender euphoria, gender identity, genderqueer, guest, guest comic, nonbinary, queer, trans, transgender
